citation.article-title: Reclassification of Salegentibacter catena Ying et al. 2007 as Salinimicrobium catena gen. nov., comb. nov. and description of Salinimicrobium xinjiangense sp. nov., a halophilic bacterium isolated from Xinjiang province in China.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Salinimicrobium (Sa.li.ni.mi.cro′bi.um. L. pl. n. salinae salt-works, salt-pits; N.L. neut. n. microbium microbe; N.L. neut. n. Salinimicrobium small, saline microbe).
Devoid of flagellar and gliding motilities.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 1, iso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0, C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, summed feature 3 (comprising iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7c), iso-C17 : 0 3-OH and C17 : 0 2-OH.
The DNA G+C content is 42.1–44.4 mol% (HPLC).
Phylogenetically, the genus belongs to the family Flavobacteriaceae.
The type species is Salinimicrobium catena.
